title: Cannot fully install/use GNU Linux target from Windows
body:
Hello, I am trying to configure rustup to allow for cross-compilation targeting Linux binaries from a Windows host. However, the installation of the GNU Linux target appears to feature some kind of error message, and when I try to use this target via xargo, some part of the Rust system complains that it cannot find that target.

Trace:

```
$ rustup install stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
info: syncing channel updates for 'stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu'
252.1 KiB / 252.1 KiB (100 %) 113.5 KiB/s ETA:   0 s
info: latest update on 2018-01-04, rust version 1.23.0 (766bd11c8 2018-01-01)
info: downloading component 'rustc'
 45.0 MiB /  45.0 MiB (100 %)   1.2 MiB/s ETA:   0 s
info: downloading component 'rust-std'
 61.2 MiB /  61.2 MiB (100 %) 489.6 KiB/s ETA:   0 s
info: downloading component 'cargo'
  4.0 MiB /   4.0 MiB (100 %)   1.2 MiB/s ETA:   0 s
info: downloading component 'rust-docs'
  4.5 MiB /   4.5 MiB (100 %)   1.1 MiB/s ETA:   0 s
info: installing component 'rustc'
info: installing component 'rust-std'
info: installing component 'cargo'
info: installing component 'rust-docs'

  stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu installed - (rustc does not exist)

$ xargo build --target x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
WARNING: the sysroot can't be built for the Stable channel. Switch to nightly.
   Compiling hello v0.0.1 (file:///C:/Users/a_pen/go/src/github.com/mcandre/toys/rust/hello)
error[E0463]: can't find crate for `std`
  |
  = note: the `x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu` target may not be installed

error: aborting due to previous error

error: Could not compile `hello`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```

I tried configuring rustup to force the stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu toolchain as default, but then when I run `rustc` after that, I get a panic message:

```
$ rustup default stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
info: using existing install for 'stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu'
info: default toolchain set to 'stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu'

  stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu unchanged - (rustc does not exist)

$ xargo build
thread 'main' panicked at 'unexpected -vV format', .cargo\registry\src\github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823\rustc_version-0.1.7\src\lib.rs:126:4
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace.
```

Is it possible to build Linux binaries with Rust from Windows hosts without resorting to containers / virtual machines?
